after: In July 2001, Bush visited Pope John Paul II at Castel Gandolfo.[224]

During his Presidential campaign, Bush's foreign policy platform included support for stronger economic and political relationship with Latin America, especially Mexico, and a reduction of involvement in "nation-building" and other small-scale military engagements. The administration pursued a national missile defense.[225] Bush was an advocate of China's entry into the World Trade Organization.[226]
